abstract: Executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase had tense exchanges with commodities regulators at a hearing Wednesday, as they faced questions about the “firewalls” that banks put up between their research and trading arms.
snippet: Executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase had tense exchanges with commodities regulators at a hearing Wednesday, as they faced questions about the “firewalls” that banks put up between their research and trading arms.
lead_paragraph: Facing tough questions from regulators, executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase said on Wednesday they were willing to allow the government to keep tabs on how well they separate their commodities research units from their trading arms.

headline.main: Goldman and JPMorgan Defend Commodity Firewalls
